body_html:
@zou3519 thanks, it's fine with 1.0.0.dev20181028

Python 3.6.6 (default, Oct 29 2018, 00:37:27)
Type 'copyright', 'credits' or 'license' for more information
IPython 7.1.1 -- An enhanced Interactive Python. Type '?' for help.

In [1]: import torch
   ...: from torch import nn
   ...:
   ...: model = nn.Linear(10, 10)
   ...:
   ...: x = torch.rand(10)
   ...: y = torch.rand(10)
   ...:
   ...: pred = model(x)

In [2]: nn.functional.mse_loss(y, pred)
Out[2]: tensor(0.4568, grad_fn=<MeanBackward1>)

In [3]: nn.functional.mse_loss(pred, y)
Out[3]: tensor(0.4568, grad_fn=<MseLossBackward>)

body:
@zou3519 thanks, it's fine with `1.0.0.dev20181028`

```
Python 3.6.6 (default, Oct 29 2018, 00:37:27)
Type 'copyright', 'credits' or 'license' for more information
IPython 7.1.1 -- An enhanced Interactive Python. Type '?' for help.

In [1]: import torch
   ...: from torch import nn
   ...:
   ...: model = nn.Linear(10, 10)
   ...:
   ...: x = torch.rand(10)
   ...: y = torch.rand(10)
   ...:
   ...: pred = model(x)

In [2]: nn.functional.mse_loss(y, pred)
Out[2]: tensor(0.4568, grad_fn=<MeanBackward1>)

In [3]: nn.functional.mse_loss(pred, y)
Out[3]: tensor(0.4568, grad_fn=<MseLossBackward>)
```
